What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I learned how to deal with differential equations

By taking ENAS S194E, I mastered the basics of Elementary Differential Equations, which I believe will be of great help in my future career because I am dedicated to finding a job related to financial engineering. Besides, I strengthened my awareness that every problem should be treated with care and never miss even the smallest details cause they might prove quite important to getting the right answer.
Diff eq; Laplace transforms, heat/wave equations, euler equations
I learned the fundamentals of ordinary and partial differential equations.
I developed not only skills to solve differential equations, but strategies for studying for difficult exams in a fast paced environment.

I learned about the applications of differential equations in physics and engineering problems that are very relevant to my course work as an engineering student. I also learned great time management and study skills thanks to the professor, TAs, and fast pace of the course.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: The course has WAY too much course load, the problem sets take north of 20 hours

Strengths: Provides an opportunity for us to have a good command of the basics of ODE&PDE within four weeks; the difficulty of the learning topics increase gradually which is very reasoable.
Weakness&Improvements: None thought of yet.
Strengths: textbook, review sessions/tests; weaknesses: really fast paced, especially the last week
The course is very fast paced, which makes sense as its a summer class.

I think the number one aspect of this class is that its fasttheres a lot of material and it takes a lot of work to keep up. I would love there to be more practice problems, and if the practice tests were offered earlier.

I enjoyed the fast pace of the course, as it allowed me to study the topics in depth as I solved problem sets and studied for exams. The course could have potentially met for less time, as we would always take a 15 minute break and still complete the required material.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: I would not recommend this course to anyone except a person who needs it as a major requirement. Particularly in the summer, it is very difficult to manage

Definitely, especially for those who failed to learn an ODE&PDE-focusing course before, as this course can let them have an overall grasp of the subject within a mere month, which I believe is quite efficient.

I would if they need it for their major or any other reason. It's a very fast paced course so you do have to keep up but I think most of the tests are fair. I think former course reviews tend to scare away students but I really think Prof. Smooke is reasonable and understands that 5 weeks is not a long time. I will say the last week/test was quite hectic and that material was the most difficult part of the course.
Yes but I think I would tell them to not take it over the summer.
I would! I think if theyre ready to take on the work its a great way to take a summer class :)

Yes. Professor Smooke is a great professor and taking the course over the summer meant that I was able to focus entirely on the material and feel like I actually learned the concepts and their applications in the real world rather than simply memorizing a problem solving process for an exam and immediately forgetting it afterwards. I think that the pacing of the course was ideal to learn the material and feel confident and prepared to enter the fall semester.

narratives.question_text: How will you use the knowledge and skills you learned in this course in your future endeavors?
comments: I found this as an interesting application to real world problems across several disciplines

ODE&PDE proves an essential tool for quant traders/researchers alike. Thanks to ENAS S194E, I had the opportunity to gain a good command of ODE&PDE in a relatively short learning period, which I believe will come to my aid both in my upcoming application for mfe and my future career as a quant.
I will use it to take another class with Professor Smooke this fall.
I need them for physics next semester! Yay quantum :)

This material is very relevant to my studies as an engineering major. I also saw connections between what we learned in class and what I'd studied in physics courses, which was very interesting. I feel confident that the material I learned will be carried forward and help me in my ongoing studies. The fast pace of the course also helped me learn more about how I learn best and develop better study and problem solving strategies that will undoubtedly help me in my future endeavors.
